item.title: LookOnChain: Source: Insider
item.description: On August 22nd, as reported by The Wall Street Journal based on sources with knowledge of the matter, Michael Faulkender, the Deputy Secretary of the U.S. Department of the Treasury, is scheduled to leave the government within less than five months after being confirmed by the Senate. Faulkender has been in charge of the Treasury Department's daily operations and briefly served as the acting commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) during a period of leadership unrest.It is reported that he is the second Senate-confirmed official of the Treasury Department to resign this month. This follows the earlier resignation of former IRS Commissioner Billy Long. During his tenure, Michael Faulkender led the Treasury Department's transition team and was involved in formulating the relevant tax policies in the tax and spending bill signed by Trump in July.

item.title: The AI Inference Network DecentralGPT Secures $7M Strategic Investment, Led by AGICrypto
item.description: On August 22nd, as per official information, the decentralized AI inference network DecentralGPT announced the successful completion of a $7 million strategic investment, with AGICrypto taking the lead. DecentralGPT declared that all the investor tokens are locked for a period of 1 year.On April 9th, DecentralGPT announced that it had recently completed a $3 million equivalent asset angel round and Series A strategic financing. This financing round was led by the globally renowned digital asset investment institution AGICrypto Capital, and was participated in by multiple top institutions in the Web3 field such as Cherry Ventures, BTR Capital, DePINX, and Aethir.

item.title: US Stock Market and Cryptocurrency Stocks opened with mixed results, SBET up by 1.77%
item.description: On August 22nd, based on market information, US stock cryptocurrency shares opened with a mixed performance:Coinbase (COIN) decreased by 0.4%;Circle (CRCL) increased by 0.54%;MicroStrategy (MSTR) fell by 1.14%;Bitmine (BMNR) dropped by 0.84%;SharpLink Gaming (SBET), which announced a $1.5 billion stock repurchase plan today, rose by 1.77%.

item.title: The South Korean court has ordered Wemade to compensate a former employee approximately $7.14 million in arrears.
item.description: August 22nd. As per Nwes1, the Seoul Central District Court has issued a partial ruling in favor of the plaintiffs in a compensation lawsuit that current and former employees had brought against Wemade. The court has determined that Wemade is required to compensate them a combined total of 99.3928 billion Korean won (approximately $7.14 million).In July of the previous year, 27 current and former executives and employees of Wemade filed a lawsuit against the company, seeking 161.7648 billion Korean won in compensation. Those who had been working at Wemade's subsidiary, Wemade Tree, claimed that the company had promised to make payments but had failed to do so, thus leading to the filing of the lawsuit.

item.title: Fed's Collins: Current US Economic Inflation Faces Upside Risk, Labor Faces Downside Risk
item.description: August 22: Federal Reserve official Collins noted that the current US economic inflation is exposed to upside risks, while the labor market is facing downside risks. We cannot afford to wait for all uncertainties to subside (in order to discuss interest rate adjustments).

item.title: The Trinity Dispute Resolution Plan (DvP) for Security Tokens Based on Stablecoins Launched to Facilitate Cross-Chain Settlement between Japanese Stablecoin and Security Token.
item.description: August 22nd. According to an official announcement by Cosmos, Project Trinity, a DvP (Delivery versus Payment) settlement project driven by stablecoins and initiated by financial institutions such as Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (SMBC), Progmat, Boostry, and Datachain, has officially begun. TOKI is participating in this project as a technical partner. The project intends to utilize the IBC protocol and LCP technology to achieve cross-chain atomic swaps between stablecoins and security tokens across blockchain platforms like Avalanche and Quorum.Currently, in Japan, the stablecoin market has been growing rapidly following the updates to the "Payment Services Act," enabling the compliant issuance of stablecoins to facilitate more efficient and secure financial transaction settlements. The security token market continues to expand, with the issuance reaching over 193.8 billion yen (approximately 1.3 billion USD) by the end of July 2025. Project Trinity aims to eventually achieve

item.title: Huaxin Capital Partners with YZi Labs to Invest Approximately $100 Million in Strategic Allocation of BNB Assets
item.description: On August 22nd, according to an announcement from the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, Huaxing Capital has announced a strategic cooperation memorandum with YZi Labs. The purpose is to support applications in the BNB and BNB Chain ecosystems and establish a mutually beneficial partnership. The cooperation includes the following aspects:Huaxing Capital's leading strategic BNB special allocation: The company will invest approximately $100 million in a special allocation of BNB assets, aiming to become the first Hong Kong-listed company to include BNB in a special digital asset allocation.Promotion of Web3 ecosystem-related initiatives and facilitation of BNB's listing on compliant exchanges.Establishment of a Real World Asset (RWA) Fund and promotion of BNB Chain ecosystem projects.

item.title: Arthur Hayes: If Powell delivers a hawkish speech tonight, ETH may retest $4000
item.description: On August 22nd, Arthur Hayes, the co-founder of BitMEX, expressed his views on the impact of Powell's interest rate policy on the crypto market during his appearance on the Crypto Banter podcast. The key points are as follows:1. He doesn't believe that Powell has to do anything. Personally, he won't trade based on the assumption that "the Fed cuts rates by 50 basis points." If Powell insists on not cutting rates, the government will definitely find a way to "squeeze out liquidity."2. The market is very likely to replay the 2022 scenario - anticipating a rate cut, but Powell suddenly delivers a "hawkish blow," resulting in a market crash.3. If Powell delivers a hawkish speech at Jackson Hole, ETH may retest $4000 first.Regarding stablecoins, Arthur Hayes said that people's imagination about stablecoins is not big enough. Treasury Secretary Benson will use stablecoins to reverse the trend of "de-dollarization" - bringing back global offshore dollar flows to the United States whil

item.title: Market Betting Powell to Stay Hawkish on Rate Cuts
item.description: August 22nd. The data of currency options indicates that the bullish sentiment towards the US dollar has reached the highest level in three weeks. Traders are betting that Powell will not adopt an overly dovish stance on interest rate cuts. "The possibility of a 25-basis-point rate cut in September will be maintained," said Sonja Martens, the director of FX and currency policy research at Deutsche Bank. "But I don't think he will be more aggressive than that."Martens suggested that Powell may resist the pressure from Trump for rate cuts and will "very clearly show that he will not take a path that may lack fundamental support due to the pressure from the White House." Nick Rees, the head of macro research at Monex Europe, said that if the market "overreacts" to any hints from Powell about a possible rate cut in September, it may trigger the initial selling of the US dollar. However, this situation may be temporary. "Overall, we expect a hawkish tone, which will further strengthen the

item.title: Analysis: Mixed Feelings Economic Data May Force Powell to Strike a Balance in Tonight's Speech
item.description: August 22: Federal Reserve Chairman Powell is scheduled to deliver a speech at the Jackson Hole Annual Economic Symposium at 10 p.m. Beijing time on Friday. Currently, the Fed is encountering unprecedented political pressure from the United States. However, the mixed economic data may compel Powell to adopt a moderate stance, leaving key issues unresolved.Regarding the interest rate policy, some analysts anticipate a middle-of-the-road approach. Powell may potentially leave the door open for a rate cut in September to recognize the necessity for further easing due to weak job growth. Nevertheless, he will not make more definite commitments until policymakers are more certain that the rising inflation is temporary. This stance may not satisfy Trump, who advocates for a significant cut in rates to around 1%, nor investors who are betting on multiple rate cuts this year. Although the market's confidence in a September rate cut has already shown signs of wavering. (Golde
